On salary negotiations it was said: "try to ask for as little as possible". https://t.co/QTqTQVOMhG
The meeting had been agreed last Friday between the owner of the guild of La Fraternidad, Omar Maturano, and Triaca.
The Government is concerned (and it suits you) to have a good relationship with this sector, because of the weight it has when a measure of force is made.
Triaca arrived accompanied by Abad to talk about the issue that worries these unions: the Income Tax.
The law that was approved towards the end of last year did not have the expected impact when it came to collecting the salary.
Schmid participated; Omar Pérez (truck drivers), Caligari and Fernández (UTA) and by Aeronavegantes, Juan Pablo Brey. https://t.co/QTqTQVOMhG
The climate of the meeting was relaxed. Maturano warned Triaca that the menu did not include choripanes. Everyone celebrated the occurrence.
Brey said that there was "sparingly" talked about and the leaders told Triaca that the average should be in the order of 25%
The aeronautical acknowledged that the minister only said: "Let's try to ask for as little as possible."
The first to retire was Triaca, who said the meeting had been "very positive". 😳
Triaca promised dialogue tables because, as one of the trade unionists told him: "if you help us then we help you".

The photo you see is of Néstor in the gardens of the Maison de l'Amérique Latine in Paris, on July 16, 2003. https://t.co/j5lOt0vj8u
He had not assumed two months as president of all Argentines and on his first trip abroad he accepted a meeting ...
Informal and public requested before the Argentine Embassy in Paris, by two delegates appointed by the External Scholars of CONICET.
The delegates were Julián Petrulevicius and Gabriel Morón. Julian is the one who is shaking his hand in the photo.
In that meeting Néstor explained to them the plans of his Government for the Argentine scientific system.
Julian remembers that Néstor told them that he was going to give back the equation of the resources destined to debt payment and education and science.

There was Pedro Gutiérrez, Doctor in Geological Sciences of the University of Buenos Aires (1988). Researcher at CONICET since 1990 ...
Pedro works at the Argentine Museum of Natural Sciences "B. Rivadavia" (Executing Unit of CONICET) ...
In 2016, both scientists described a series of species, genera, families and insect orders of 325 million years in La Rioja.
The species found are the oldest winged insects in the world (apart from the Argentines there is only one in the Czech Republic)
And they were named by scientists as "Argentinala Cristinae", "Tupacsala niunamenos" and "Kirchnerala thirty thousand are" 😁😁😁
